title: The Trekvliet Shipping Canal near Rijswijk, known as the ‘View near the Geest Bridge’
titles: The Trekvliet Shipping Canal near Rijswijk, known as the ‘View near the Geest Bridge’
description: Voorstelling getiteld 'Gezicht bij de Geestbrug'. Rivierlandschap met de Trekvliet bij Rijswijk met in de verte links kasteel De Binckhorst en rechts de Laakmolen. Op de weg naar de boerderij staat een vrouw met kinderen, op het water zeilen boten.

label.title: The Trekvliet Shipping Canal near Rijswijk, known as the ‘View near the Geest Bridge’
label.makerLine: Johan Hendrik Weissenbruch (1824–1903), oil on panel, 1868
label.description: A tranquil landscape executed in bright colours: this early painting by Weissenbruch is still very Romantic in feel. Yet unlike the Romantic painters, Weissenbruch did not alter reality to suit his imagination, but gave a topographically accurate representation. The Trekvliet Canal linked The Hague with the neighbouring villages of Rijswijk and Voorburg. In the distance at left is the tower of De Binckhorst Castle, and the windmill called the Laakmolen at right.
